awd_titl_txt: Development of a Layered Computer System Environment for    Undergraduate Computer Science at Fisk University
awd_abstract_narration: This award creates a multi-user and multi-tool computing                        environment that will enhance the teaching of computer science.                 The equipment purchased is used to: 1) improve instruction in                   the existing curriculum; 2) develop upper level courses; such                   as computer graphics, database management and software                          engineering; 3) initiate undergraduate research by providing                    accessibility to other computer systems (on and off campus),                    scientific databases, and collaboration with researchers on                     this campus as well as at other institutions; 4) provide                        linkage to an existing computer science laboratory; and 5)                      provide a basis for network linkage with other universities,                    government, and industry.  The equipment is a Dec MicroVax 3300                 server with eight workstations and two DECstations 2100 ULTRIX                  workstations networded together.
